author: spacemonkeyforta
content:
Hi <@727296082484265073> <@550420431744794624> - we're gearing up to submit our Precompile RIP. It was previously suggested in this channel to do the following:

Create a PR in the RIPs repo
Discuss with rollup teams to see who would consider implementing (directly or via Eth Magicians?)
Present on RollCall

Is this still the process/order you would recommend? Should we post in Ethereum Magicians first?

author: ulerdogan
content: Posting on Magicians is great to present the idea and keep the discussion/feedback history. I'd post there first. Also, before improving the proposal and idea, I'd not discuss for implementations with rollups. The proposal can change with lots of feedback.

author: ulerdogan
content: You can just ask for the ideas of the rollup teams by presenting in a RollCall in the Draft period. Then, the discussion can turn into a more mature implementation discussion with a more finalized proposal in another RollCall.

author: spacemonkeyforta
content:
Thanks <@691283857206542386>. Just so I've got it straight, you're saying...

1. Post in Ethereum Magicians
2. In parallel, present draft in RollCall and solicit ideas/feedback from L2s
3. Submit formal RIP proposal 
4. Second RollCall

author: ulerdogan
content: Yes. The first RollCall presence is just to get feedback in a few mins. If you can reach enough L2 teams without presenting the proposal in the RollCall, you can skip this step. Also, there is no strict submission step (for 3rd). It can be a moment that you are confident with the previous feedback and improvements.

author: spacemonkeyforta
content: <@691283857206542386> When should we submit the proposal in this format? https://github.com/ethereum/RIPs/blob/e0ce6e9614d5bf152df9f34aee361b2456b3c752/RIPS/rip-7559.md

author: ulerdogan
content: I think good to submit any time. It will be open to change until being 'Final'

author: spacemonkeyforta
content: Understood. But not on the Ethereum Magicians forum, correct? For that, we just need to share the rough idea for feedback

author: spacemonkeyforta
content: Sorry for the pedestrian questions. This is our first time submitting an EIP/RIP so just unfamiliar with the process

author: ulerdogan
content: You can share the post before or with the PR. Early post may helps you to get some feedback before opening the PR, but getting feedback with an opened PR is easier.

author: spacemonkeyforta
content: <@691283857206542386> Got it, thank you very much
